entry.title: I'll Let You Leave Me Too (Keep Me Please)
entry.summary:
Author: OdetteSeashell

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,493Chapters: 4/5Kudos: 98

Summary: Evan Buckley is sitting down in his therapist's office, letting her pull on the threads that make his issues, hoping to find a way to cope over his best bud's decision, Eddie's imminent departure, without setting himself on fire, or something like that.Instead, he realises he's been standing on the line between friend and life partner to his favourite person for a little less than 7 years and he freaks out about it.Or, Dr. Copeland wishes she could send them to couples therapy but she can only pray Buck be brave enough to cross the line and smooch his husband before he leaves for Texas.

This was apparently the wrong thing to say, because Buck peeled his body away from the cushions into a mostly upright position and glared at Eddie.

entry.title: Lighthouse
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 89,420Chapters: 16/28Kudos: 614

Summary: Buck had lost-- he was sure of this now. His resolve only lasted a few weeks before his exterior began to crack; he was never a very good actor. He couldn’t keep up the greetings and the asking questions and the easy stroll. He let his shoulders creep up to his ears, let his foot tap incessantly. He did what his Captain told him, but stopped asking for anything more. Stopped following the conversation in the back of the engine on the way to the call; he just stared out the window, thinking about the case to come, preparing for it. When he woke every morning, there was no big recovery milestone to strive for, no big fight for the soul of his career to win. Not even the happy swell of being back on shift -- something so easy to dismiss, that had dominated so much of his life, that he had taken for granted-- that had catalyzed him each morning of his first week back.An old habit of his had returned. A bad habit.~~or: after the lawsuit, buck confronts what it was he wanted all along. he looks and looks and longs for it; the team look right through him. buck breaks-- right down the middle.

entry.title: I Wanna be in the Sequel
entry.summary:
Author: OrYouCouldHaveMine

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 120,398Chapters: 24/24Kudos: 752

Summary: It's a few months after Maddie kills her husband and stages it to look like a suicide that she moves to LA to live with her brother. Buck was fired from the fire department and was seeking meaning. Maddie was facing freedom for the first time in her life and seeking justice for others like her.The 9-1-1 call center is the perfect spot to get details on where some of the most evil people in LA live. Maddie gets their info. Buck takes care of them in disguise. It's foolproof, until one night, Buck ends up at the wrong house.or: A 9-1-1 meets Scream (1996) AUthe Buckley siblings work together to rid the world of abusers though some nonconventional methods. Buck is Ghostface, a serial killer running loose in LA. Maddie is the mastermind behind it. Taylor Kelly is the pesky reporter. And Eddie Diaz? He's the almost accidental victim, the new friend, the obsession that bleeds into the blurry space where Buck and Ghostface come together. He's everything Buck wants. He's everything Ghostface knows he can't have.But what if Eddie wants both of them?

entry.title: Through Fire and Time II (9-1-1 x 9-1-1: Lone Star Fanfic)
entry.summary:
Author: actuallynate

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,429Chapters: 2/31Kudos: 3

Summary: Same number, different city.Elliot "Eli" Hayes thought he had found stability and belonging with the 126 in Austin - a firehouse that helped him heal from his past and grow into his role as a paramedic. But life, as unpredictable as ever, throws him a curveball when a sudden reshuffle forces him to temporarily leave the comfort of the firehouse family and take up a position with the 118 in Los Angeles.Returning to his hometown stirs up old memories, unresolved grief, and unexpected challenges. With his panic disorder still a lingering shadow, Eli must navigate the dynamic and high-pressure environment of the 118 while proving himself to a new team.Meanwhile, his close friend, Ravi Panikkar, struggles to find his footing at the 252 firehouse in New York under the shadow of Captain Sal Deluca, a once respected leader whose toxic ways threaten to unravel Ravi's confidence and safety.TRIGGER WARNING: This story contains themes of panic disorder, hypochondria, and anxiety attacks, as well as references to trauma, medical procedures, suicide, drug names and high-stress emergency situations. Reader discretion is advised.

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,104Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 43

Summary: Eddie wants to yell at Tommy for breaking up with Buck. He does not question why. When he does, he has some revelations.--“I’m not gay,” Eddie chokes out.Tommy doesn’t laugh at him. “Sure. You’re just in love with Buck.”Eddie tries not to let it affect him.He fails miserably.

entry.title: We Are Such Stuff As Dreams Are Made Of
entry.summary:
Author: Fanfic_or_bust

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 38,611Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 129

Summary: “Well I hope we do more than sleep. But I think it should get first priority, at least.” Buck replied with a wink, and what did *that* mean? All Eddie could do was gape in response, his brain stuck as it refused to catch up, to understand what the hell was happening. And it wasn’t helped when - defying any conventions that they’d previously established in their friendship - Buck turned around and pulled back the covers, climbing into Eddie’s bed as though it was his own. As though this was something totally normal that they did all the time.ORThe one where Eddie transfers Fire Houses after moving to El Paso, and ends up in a coma after a rescue went bad. But unlike Buck's coma dream experience, Eddie doesn't feel like he has anything to wake up for - and everything to stay asleep for. But that doesn't mean Buck is going to stop fighting for him.

entry.title: Badly Beaten Self Esteem Has Got Me Needing You
entry.summary:
Author: bvddiesbro

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,671Chapters: 2/8Kudos: 16

Summary: Who did he think he was anyway, strolling into the 118 with his hair and his body and his eyes, with a smirk that bled confidence. Who did he think he was to appear and insert himself into their family like he belonged when Buck himself had grafted, scraped and clawed his way to belonging.He could feel Bobby’s eyes on him, he could feel Hen wanting to reach out, could feel Chimney’s confusion but they didn’t understand. This, the firehouse, this team, this family was his. It was all Buck had. They didn’t understand how threatened he felt, his hackles raised and chest tense everytime Bobby clapped Eddie on the shoulder. They didn’t know about the nausea that clawed at him every time Chimney poked fun at Buck, with Eddie. They couldn’t fathom the way his head spun every time Hen complimented Eddie on his skills as a medic, sounding genuinely impressed.OrBuck has some serious undiagnosed mental health issues, pushes them aside and becomes everyone's sounding board, soaks up their problems and ignores his own, until he can't anymore.OrBuck slowly realises that maybe he's not a burden, that he doesn't need to make his problems smaller to make room for others.

  • Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings

entry.title: In It To Win It
entry.summary:
Author: tinypeckers

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,710Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 7

Summary: Day 104 of 105 days of 9-1-1 hiatusThe LAFD's annual charity event should have been a happy one, but for Eddie it felt more like Sophie's choice. With his parents in town on a 'trial run' for whether he could handle his own son, Eddie has to grapple with living up to their extremelty high expectations of him and the equally as high expectations of his best friend who just wants Eddie to join his Double Dutch team.Is his heart in the game (boxing) or in the song (double dutch)? (Loosely inspired by the DCOM Jump In)

entry.title: A thousand people I could be for you (and you hate the fucking lot)
entry.summary:
Author: Tamystardust

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,287Chapters: 7/7Kudos: 141

Summary: Chimney had never met people so uncomfortable around their own children.Not just uncomfortable, but awkward, in the way you would be if you were forced to socialize with a friend of a friend, someone you didn’t really like, that you had talked shit about behind their back, and pretended you didn’t know the worst of them.Or when strangers forced their small talk on you, and you’ve never been socialized in your life, living like a recluse behind shut windows and closed doors, keeping you in and everyone else out.So, that, but with your own children.
